trans-unit.source: Upload images to Azure Storage from a Windows Phone Silverlight app | Microsoft Azure
trans-unit.target: Upload images to Azure Storage from a Windows Phone Silverlight app | Microsoft Azure

trans-unit.source: Learn how to use Mobile Services to upload images from a Windows Phone Silverlight app to Azure Blob Storage.
trans-unit.target: Learn how to use Mobile Services to upload images from a Windows Phone Silverlight app to Azure Blob Storage.

trans-unit.source: Upload images to Azure Storage by using Mobile Services
trans-unit.target: Upload images to Azure Storage by using Mobile Services

trans-unit.source: Overview
trans-unit.target: Overview

trans-unit.source: This topic shows you how to use Azure Mobile Services to enable your app to upload and store user-generated images in Azure Storage.
trans-unit.target: This topic shows you how to use Azure Mobile Services to enable your app to upload and store user-generated images in Azure Storage.

trans-unit.source: Mobile Services uses a SQL Database to store data.
trans-unit.target: Mobile Services uses a SQL Database to store data.

trans-unit.source: However, binary large object (BLOB) data is more efficiently stored in Azure Blob storage service.
trans-unit.target: However, binary large object (BLOB) data is more efficiently stored in Azure Blob storage service.

trans-unit.source: You cannot securely distribute with the client app the credentials required to securely upload data to the Blob Storage service.
trans-unit.target: You cannot securely distribute with the client app the credentials required to securely upload data to the Blob Storage service.

trans-unit.source: Instead, you must store these credentials your mobile service and use them to generate a Shared Access Signature (SAS) that is used to upload a new image.
trans-unit.target: Instead, you must store these credentials your mobile service and use them to generate a Shared Access Signature (SAS) that is used to upload a new image.

trans-unit.source: The SAS, a credential with a short expiration—in this case 5 minutes, is returned securely by Mobile Services to the client app.
trans-unit.target: The SAS, a credential with a short expiration—in this case 5 minutes, is returned securely by Mobile Services to the client app.

trans-unit.source: The app then uses this temporary credential to upload the image.
trans-unit.target: The app then uses this temporary credential to upload the image.

trans-unit.source: In this example, downloads from the Blob service are public.
trans-unit.target: In this example, downloads from the Blob service are public.

trans-unit.source: In this tutorial, you add functionality to the [GetStartedWithData sample app project](mobile-services-windows-phone-get-started-data.md) to take pictures and upload the images to Azure by using an SAS generated by Mobile Services.
trans-unit.target: In this tutorial, you add functionality to the [GetStartedWithData sample app project](mobile-services-windows-phone-get-started-data.md) to take pictures and upload the images to Azure by using an SAS generated by Mobile Services.

trans-unit.source: Prerequisites
trans-unit.target: Prerequisites

trans-unit.source: This tutorial requires the following:
trans-unit.target: This tutorial requires the following:

trans-unit.source: Microsoft Visual Studio 2012 Express for Windows 8, or a later version
trans-unit.target: Microsoft Visual Studio 2012 Express for Windows 8, or a later version

trans-unit.source: [Windows Phone SDK 8.0] or higher
trans-unit.target: [Windows Phone SDK 8.0] or higher

trans-unit.source: Nuget Package Manager installed for Microsoft Visual Studio.
trans-unit.target: Nuget Package Manager installed for Microsoft Visual Studio.

trans-unit.source: Azure Storage account
trans-unit.target: Azure Storage account

trans-unit.source: Complete the tutorial [Add Mobile Services to an existing app](mobile-services-windows-phone-get-started-data.md)
trans-unit.target: Complete the tutorial [Add Mobile Services to an existing app](mobile-services-windows-phone-get-started-data.md)

trans-unit.source: Install the Storage client for Windows Phone apps
trans-unit.target: Install the Storage client for Windows Phone apps

trans-unit.source: To be able to use an SAS to upload images to Blob storage, you must first add the NuGet package that installs Storage client library for Windows Phone apps.
trans-unit.target: To be able to use an SAS to upload images to Blob storage, you must first add the NuGet package that installs Storage client library for Windows Phone apps.

trans-unit.source: In **Solution Explorer** in Visual Studio, right-click the project name, and then select **Manage NuGet Packages**.
trans-unit.target: In **Solution Explorer** in Visual Studio, right-click the project name, and then select **Manage NuGet Packages**.

trans-unit.source: In the left pane, select the **Online** category, select **Include Prerelease**, search for **WindowsAzure.Storage-Preview**, click **Install** on the **Azure Storage** package, then accept the license agreements.
trans-unit.target: In the left pane, select the **Online** category, select **Include Prerelease**, search for **WindowsAzure.Storage-Preview**, click **Install** on the **Azure Storage** package, then accept the license agreements.

trans-unit.source: Add Azure Storage NuGet
trans-unit.target: Add Azure Storage NuGet

trans-unit.source: This adds the client library for Azure storage services to the project.
trans-unit.target: This adds the client library for Azure storage services to the project.

trans-unit.source: Next, you will update the quickstart app to capture and upload images.
trans-unit.target: Next, you will update the quickstart app to capture and upload images.

trans-unit.source: Update the registered insert script in the Management Portal
trans-unit.target: Update the registered insert script in the Management Portal

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.NOTE]To add new properties to the TodoItem object, you must have Dynamic Schema enabled in your mobile service.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.NOTE]To add new properties to the TodoItem object, you must have Dynamic Schema enabled in your mobile service.

trans-unit.source: When Dynamic Schema is enabled, new columns are automatically added to the TodoItem table that map to these new properties.
trans-unit.target: When Dynamic Schema is enabled, new columns are automatically added to the TodoItem table that map to these new properties.

trans-unit.source: Next steps
trans-unit.target: Next steps

trans-unit.target: Now that you have been able to securely upload images by integrating your mobile service with the Blob service, check out some of the other backend service and integration topics:

trans-unit.source: Send email from Mobile Services with SendGrid
trans-unit.target: Send email from Mobile Services with SendGrid

trans-unit.source: Learn how to add email functionality to your Mobile Service using the SendGrid email service.
trans-unit.target: Learn how to add email functionality to your Mobile Service using the SendGrid email service.

trans-unit.source: This topic demonstrates how to add server side scripts to send email using SendGrid.
trans-unit.target: This topic demonstrates how to add server side scripts to send email using SendGrid.

trans-unit.source: Schedule backend jobs in Mobile Services
trans-unit.target: Schedule backend jobs in Mobile Services

trans-unit.source: Learn how to use the Mobile Services job scheduler functionality to define server script code that is executed on a schedule that you define.
trans-unit.target: Learn how to use the Mobile Services job scheduler functionality to define server script code that is executed on a schedule that you define.
